mercs.name: apeiron
mercs.ability: Won't use grenades or mortars.
mercs.bio: His brother died in an explosion.

mercs.name: badger
mercs.ability: Always has initiative over militia.
mercs.bio: Was a wrestler for Wisconsin.

mercs.name: basic
mercs.ability: May reroll all dice once per combat.
mercs.bio: Repeated basic training 4 times.

mercs.name: borris
mercs.ability: Will not work with Squirrel.
mercs.bio: Often requests assignments with Natasha.

mercs.name: bouba
mercs.ability: +1 combat when using a handgun.
mercs.bio: Wants desperately to be a good MERC.

mercs.name: buzzkill
mercs.ability: Always attacks enemy MERCs instead of militia when possible.
mercs.bio: Killed his cellmate for using an electric razor.

mercs.name: doc
mercs.ability: Heals all MERCs in his squad as a free action outside of combat.
mercs.bio: Put pressure here.

mercs.name: ewok
mercs.ability: +1 action.
mercs.bio: She often spouts Star Wars trivia.

mercs.name: faustina
mercs.ability: +1 action, for training only.
mercs.bio: Attitude goes further than fortitude.

mercs.name: feedback
mercs.ability: Spend 1 action to take 1 piece of equipment from the discard pile.
mercs.bio: If it sparks, I can fix it.

mercs.name: genesis
mercs.ability: May carry an extra weapon in his accessory slot instead of an accessory.
mercs.bio: Jack of all trades.

mercs.name: gunther
mercs.ability: He can use all equipment slots to carry accessories.
mercs.bio: There's no problem that's too big.

mercs.name: haarg
mercs.ability: +1 to any skill that anyone in his squad has higher than him.
mercs.bio: It's been done before, but I can do it better.

mercs.name: juicer
mercs.ability: +2 health.
mercs.bio: Don't hire if you do drug screening.

mercs.name: kastern
mercs.ability: Always goes first in combat.
mercs.bio: Likes to sing nursery rhymes while in combat.

mercs.name: khenn
mercs.ability: Rolls a D6 at the beginning of combat. That is his initiative for this combat.
mercs.bio: He's a cheap bastard.

mercs.name: lucid
mercs.ability: Hits on a 3+.
mercs.bio: Hates it when people call him a contractor.

mercs.name: max
mercs.ability: Opposing MERCs have -1 to all skills when attacking his squad.
mercs.bio: After 25 years of service, founded MERC.

mercs.name: mayhem
mercs.ability: +2 combat when using an Uzi.
mercs.bio: Became a MERC because his neighborhood was too violent.

mercs.name: meatbop
mercs.ability: Will not fight without an accessory equipped.
mercs.bio: Has a habit of 'misplacing' his gun.

mercs.name: moose
mercs.ability: Will not work with Borris.
mercs.bio: Grew up on the same street as Squirrel.

mercs.name: natasha
mercs.ability: Will not work with Moose.
mercs.bio: Kinda has a thing for Squirrel.

mercs.name: preaction
mercs.ability: Automatically restores 1 health each day until fully healed.
mercs.bio: Prefers to work at night.

mercs.name: ra
mercs.ability: +1 target with any weapon.
mercs.bio: Always brings the beer.

mercs.name: rizen
mercs.ability: Regardless of weapon used, each hit counts as a new target when attacking militia.

mercs.name: rozeske
mercs.ability: +1 combat while wearing armor.
mercs.bio: He's a MERC because he likes to travel.

mercs.name: runde
mercs.ability: Is always the last MERC targeted.
mercs.bio: This grainy photo is the only known image of him.

mercs.name: sarge
mercs.ability: +1 to all skills when his initiative is highest in the squad.
mercs.bio: OohRah!

mercs.name: shadkaam
mercs.ability: Immune to attack dogs.
mercs.bio: With me you will be triumphant.

mercs.name: shooter
mercs.ability: Is an extremely good shot.
mercs.bio: Volunteered for two tours in a hot zone.

mercs.name: snake
mercs.ability: +1 to all skills when working alone.
mercs.bio: Named himself after his hero Snake Pliskin.

mercs.name: sonia
mercs.ability: She can bring up to 2 militia with her when she moves.
mercs.bio: She's also an Olympic gymnastics champion.

mercs.name: squidhead
mercs.ability: Disarms enemy land mines when he enters a sector. May re-arm them for himself.
mercs.bio: Live hard.

mercs.name: squirrel
mercs.ability: Will not work with Natasha.
mercs.bio: Thinks Borris has a weirdly shaped head.

mercs.name: stumpy
mercs.ability: +1 combat with grenades and mortars.
mercs.bio: Wants to follow in his grandfather's footsteps.

mercs.name: surgeon
mercs.ability: May discard 1 combat die before he fires to restore 1 health to anyone in his squad.
mercs.bio: Got a medical discharge for injuring his foot in Iraq.

mercs.name: tack
mercs.ability: +2 initiative to her squad when she has the highest initiative.
mercs.bio: Is a tactical driving instructor for the LAPD.

mercs.name: tao
mercs.ability: Will not harm dogs.
mercs.bio: He's also a french-trained pastry chef.

mercs.name: tavisto
mercs.ability: +1 to all skills when a woman is in his squad.
mercs.bio: Don't pee in my Cheerios!

mercs.name: teresa
mercs.ability: Doesn't count toward team limit.
mercs.bio: Was working for Red Cross when the Rebels invaded.

mercs.name: valkyrie
mercs.ability: Gives +1 initiative to all other MERCs in her squad.
mercs.bio: She's also a classicly trained opera singer.

mercs.name: vandal
mercs.ability: Fires a second shot at the end of each round of combat.
mercs.bio: Freelance hitman, before joining MERC.

mercs.name: vandradi
mercs.ability: +1 combat when using a weapon that adds 1 or more targets.
mercs.bio: Hell comes with me.

mercs.name: vrbansk
mercs.ability: When he's hired, give him the top card from the accessories deck.
mercs.bio: This ain't no f\*\*\* around operation.

mercs.name: vulture
mercs.ability: Ignores initiative penalties from equipment.
mercs.bio: Has a degree in architecture.

mercs.name: walter
mercs.ability: +2 Initiative to his militia when he's present.
mercs.bio: He's very proud of his grandson.

mercs.name: wolverine
mercs.ability: Any 6s rolled during combat may be used on targets other than his declared target.
mercs.bio: Semper Fi, motherf\*\*\*er.

mercs.name: Adelheid
mercs.ability: Each hit targeting militia can convert the militia to her side rather than killing it.
mercs.bio: Everyone loves their mom.

mercs.name: Dutch
mercs.ability: If he has no weapon add +1 to his combat and initiative, as he always carries his sword.
mercs.bio: Is a world-class sword fighting instructor.

mercs.name: golem
mercs.ability: May attack any 1 target before the first round of combat.
mercs.bio: I am a sneaky bastard. Sir!

mercs.name: hagness
mercs.ability: Spend 1 action to draw 3 pieces of equipment, choose 1 and give it to any member of his squad.
mercs.bio: He's a natural negotiator.

mercs.name: moe
mercs.ability: +1 target when using a SMAW.
mercs.bio: Been there. Done that. Let's do it again.

equipment.name: Attack Dog
equipment.description: Assign to an enemy MERC on your initiative before your attack. Assigned MERC can take no action except to attack the dog. Dog has 3 health.

equipment.name: Bandolier
equipment.description: Gives 2 extra accessory slots. Cannot be combined with another bandolier.

equipment.name: Body Armor with Ceramic Plates and Kevlar Helmet
Epinephrine Shot
equipment.description: Discard to prevent the death of self or another MERC, restores 1 health.

equipment.name: First Aid Kit
equipment.description: On your initiative before your attack, discard 1 combat dice to heal 1 wound (per die discarded) on self or another MERC. Discard after 1 use.

equipment.name: Flak Vest with Ceramic Plates and Kevlar Helmet
Kevlar Vest with Ceramic Plates and Kevlar Helmet
Land Mine
equipment.description: Place in an equipment stash in a sector you control. When an enemy enters the sector, declare you have planted a mine and it will explode dealing 1 damage to every target.

equipment.name: Medical Kit
equipment.description: On your initiative, before your attack, discard 1 combat dice to heal 1 wound (per dice discarded) on self or another MERC. Discard after 3 uses.

equipment.name: Repair Kit
equipment.description: Discard this card to take 1 card from any equipment discard pile.

equipment.name: Chopper
equipment.description: For 1 action move 2 spaces a squad of up to 4 MERCs/militia. Movement may be diagonal.

equipment.name: Detonator
equipment.description: If you also have the Explosives you win! Each Rebel may not have more than 1.

equipment.name: Deuce
equipment.description: For 1 action move 1 space a squad of up to 10 MERCs/militia.

equipment.name: Explosives
equipment.description: If you also have a Detonator, you win! Each Rebel may not have more than 1.

equipment.name: Humvee
equipment.description: For 1 action move 2 spaces a squad of up to 4 MERCs/militia.

equipment.name: Jeep
equipment.description: For 1 action move 2 spaces a squad of up to 4 MERCs/militia.

equipment.name: Tank
equipment.description: For 2 actions move 1 space a squad of up to 4 MERCs/militia.

dictators.name: Castro
dictators.ability: Once per turn, draw 3 random MERCs and hire 1.

dictators.name: Kim
dictators.ability: Your base starts revealed with 5 militia per Rebel (max 20). Once per turn, count the number of Rebel controlled sectors, and place that many militia on any sector.

dictatorTactics.name: Artillery Barrage
dictatorTactics.story: You use a stockpile of mortars to weaken enemy lines.
dictatorTactics.description: Attack sectors adjacent to sectors you control. The max number of sectors you can attack is equal to the number of rebel players. Roll a D6 for each of these sectors, that's how many targets are hit. Each take 1 damage. Rebels can choose whether to apply the hits to MERCs or militia.

dictatorTactics.name: Better Weapons
dictatorTactics.story: You decide to stop being cheap and upgrade your militia's guns.
dictatorTactics.description: Reveal your base if you have not already done so.

dictatorTactics.name: Family Threat
dictatorTactics.story: You threaten to round up and kill the children who cannot show 2 parents when your militia come to the house.
dictatorTactics.description: Your threats are working. Each rebel sector loses 2 militia as they run home to their families.

dictatorTactics.name: Fodder
dictatorTactics.story: So what if you lose some militia? Maybe it will distract the rebels long enough for you to form a better plan.
dictatorTactics.description: Look for the sectors containing the most militia for each rebel player. Divide the number of their militia in half (round up). Send that many of your militia to those sectors. Resolve combat immediately.

dictatorTactics.name: Generalisimo
dictatorTactics.story: It's time to bring out the big guns.
dictatorTactics.description: Reveal your base if you have not already done so.

dictatorTactics.name: Lockdown
dictatorTactics.story: It's time to prepare for the assault.
dictatorTactics.description: Reveal your base if you have not already done so.

dictatorTactics.name: Reinforcements
dictatorTactics.story: Sending your palace guards to assist in the fight, may break the backs of the rebels.
dictatorTactics.description: Count the number of rebel players, and add that many of your militia to every Industry you control.

dictatorTactics.name: Seizure
dictatorTactics.story: You order your rural residents to turn over all their firearms and supplies.
dictatorTactics.description: X = the number of rebel players.

dictatorTactics.name: Sentry
dictatorTactics.story: In an effort to slow movement, put pressure on your citizens, and increase intelligence and attrition, you populate the country-side with your militia.
dictatorTactics.description: Count half the number of rebel players (round up). Add that many of your militia to every sector that is not controlled by anybody.

dictatorTactics.name: Veteran Militia
dictatorTactics.story: You train better militia by using your elite guards to train them.
dictatorTactics.description: Reveal your base if you have not already done so.

dictatorTactics.name: Block Trade
dictatorTactics.story: Perhaps you can stop the rebels if you take away their ability to re-supply.
dictatorTactics.description: Flip all cities to their explored side.

dictatorTactics.name: Conscripts
dictatorTactics.story: You have decided to conscript children into your militia.
dictatorTactics.description: Count half the number of rebel players (round up). At the end of your turn, add that many of your militia to each sector you control. Do this at the end of each of your turns for the remainder of the game.

dictatorTactics.name: Oil Reserves
dictatorTactics.story: You decide to crank up your oil refinery so your MERCs can be more effective.
dictatorTactics.description: For the remainder of the game, whoever controls the oil industry gains 1 free move action for their MERCs.

dictatorTactics.name: Tainted Water
dictatorTactics.story: You are merciless and would rather kill your own citizens than give up your island. You poison the water supply.
dictatorTactics.description: Count half the number of rebel players (round up). Remove that many rebel militia from each sector and deal 1 damage to each rebel MERC, regardless of armor.
